title: async-signature v0.5.0-pre.0
body: cc @baloo @QuinnWilton

title: async-signature: remove `'static` bounds
body:
As discussed in #1375. These bounds don't add value: it requires notating them even when unnecessary, and when necessary they still need to be notated anyway.

cc @QuinnWilton

title: async-signature: bump version to v0.5.0-pre
body: NOTE: this is not a release, but just to denote that the current `master` contains breaking changes, which were introduced in #1428

title: async-signature: move to AFIT; MSRV 1.75
body: Continuation of #1419

title: Remove unused imports
body: These are breaking the build on the latest `stable`

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.8
body:
### Changed
- `SecretKey::from_slice` now allows >=24-bytes ([#1412])

[#1412]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1412

title: elliptic-curve: `SecretKey::from_slice` allows >=24-bytes
body: To address the concerns in #1330, sets a global minimum elliptic curve key size of 24-bytes (192-bits), which provides the equivalent of 96-bit symmetric security.

title: aead: enable `missing_debug_implementations` lint and add `Debug` impls
body:
The `Payload` fields may be considered secret, but they are public in the first place. Plus, usually it's used as a temporary value, so risk of unintentionally exposing sensitive data through it is quite low. IIUC nonce and position fields in the stream constructions are not considered secret, so we can expose them in `Debug`, while AEAD internals will be protected by its own `Debug` impl (if it exists).

Relevant issue: #1389

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.7
body:
### Added
- `BatchInvert` and `BatchNormalize` traits ([#1376])
- `LinearCombinationExt` trait ([#1405])

[#1376]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1376
[#1405]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1405

title: Fix `missing_debug_implementations` for some crates
body: Relevant issue: #1389

title: elliptic-curve: have `LinearCombinationExt` allow `?Sized`
body: ...as the `PointsAndScalars` generic parameter, so we can accept slices

title: elliptic-curve: add `LinearCombinationExt` trait
body:
Adds a trait which is generic around its input parameters for computing linear combinations.

This allows for different strategies depending on the input parameter type, for example using stack-allocated intermediates sized to match an input array, which works on `no_std` targets.

Or, if a slice is passed, intermediate `Vec`s can be used when the `alloc` feature is available.

Also adds a blanket impl for the old `LinearCombination` trait which calls the new trait.

title: elliptic-curve: move `BatchNormalize` trait under `point`
body: Since it's functionality related to elliptic curve points, put it under the corresponding module.

title: elliptic-curve: remove references from batch generic params
body:
Previously the traits were generic around a reference type. The problem with that is reference types have lifetimes, which requires notating them in generic code, in this case requiring an HRTB per generic parameter.

HRTBs work because the output has no lifetime dependencies on the input, but if that's the case we can just explicitly borrow in the function signature in trait, which means no HRTB is needed in generic code, which makes notating the trait bounds significantly simpler.

title: Bump `heapless` dependency to v0.8
body: Not sure why dependabot closed #1374 🤔

title: signature v2.2.0
body:
### Changed
- MSRV 1.60 ([#1387])

### Fixed
- No longer vendoring async/derive crates unintentionally ([#1391]) 

[#1387]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1387
[#1391]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1391

title: signature_derive v2.1.0
body:
### Changed
- MSRV 1.60 ([#1387])

[#1387]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1387

title: signature_derive: match directory name with crate
body: The crate name contains an underscore, not a hyphen, but #1391 accidentally used `signature-derive` instead

title: async-signature v0.4.0
body:
### Changed
- MSRV 1.60 ([#1387])

### Removed
- Mandatory `Send` + `Sync` bounds ([#1375])

[#1375]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1375
[#1387]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1387

title: async-signature: re-add 'static bound
body: Accidentally removed in #1375

title: Move `async-signature` and `signature-derive` to toplevel
body:
These crates were previously nested under `signature/async` and `signature/derive`, which complicates tooling that expects crates to be in toplevel directories, and as things currently stand also meant that releases of the `signature` crate accidentally included stale copies of the other two crates.

This commit moves them to toplevel `async-signature` and `signature-derive` directories.

title: digest: add `DynDigestWithOid` wrapper trait
body: Closes #1182

title: cipher: stream cipher improvements
body:
`StreamCipherCoreWrapper` now uses the first byte of inner buffer to store position. This PR also removes a bunch of no longer necessary bounds.

Based on #1174

title: (async-)signature: MSRV 1.60
body:
To simplify the workspace, which contains weak/namespaced features, this bumps both `async-signature` and `signature` to MSRV 1.60.

So as for the bump to have some justification, it adds weak feature activation for `rand_core?/std`, and uses this impl to write a `From<rand_core::Error>` conversion which can preserve the original error as the boxed source.

title: Apply Clippy to tests and fix some lints
universal-hash: bump crypto-common to v0.2.0-pre; MSRV 1.65
body: Replaces `generic-array` with `hybrid-array`, which is built on a combination of `typenum` and const generics, providing a degree of interoperability between the two systems.

title: aead: bump `crypto-common` to v0.2.0-pre; MSRV 1.65
body: Replaces `generic-array` with `hybrid-array`, which is built on a combination of `typenum` and const generics, providing a degree of interoperability between the two systems.

title: crypto-common: weakly activate `std` features for RNG crates
crypto-common: weakly activate `rand_core/getrandom`
body: When both `getrandom` and `rand_core` are enabled, activates the `rand_core/getrandom` feature, which makes `OsRng` available as `crypto_common::rand_core::OsRng`.

title: Exclude pre-1.60 crates from workspace
body:
Pre-1.60 crates can't be used in workspaces with other crates that use namespaced/weak features.

This commit places all MSRV 1.60+ crates into `members` and moves the ones with earlier MSRVs into `exclude`.

title: crypto-common: add fallible `try_generate_*_with_rng` functions
body: Adds a fallible `try_*` variant to each `generate_*_with_rng` function, changing usages of `fill_bytes` to `try_fill_bytes`, and returning a `Result` with `rand_core::Error` in the event an RNG error has occurred.

title: elliptic_curve: add `BatchInvert` and `BatchNormalize` traits
body: Addresses https://github.com/RustCrypto/elliptic-curves/issues/943

title: async-signature: remove mandatory Send + Sync bounds
body:
See: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/issues/1373

I've confirmed that with these changes I'm able to produce signatures from non-extractable keys in a browser, using an implementation of `AsyncSigner<S>` that calls out to the `SubtleCrypto` APIs.

I have not tested the `AsyncDigestSigner` traits in a wasm project, however I have confirmed that I'm able to build the project with the `digest` feature enabled.

title: crypto-common: change `generate_*` to support getrandom
body:
This commit splits the existing `generate_*` functions into two different variants:

- `fn generate_*`: accepts no parameters and uses `OsRng` automatically. Gated on the `getrandom` feature.
- `fn generate_*_with_rng`: accepts a `&mut impl CryptoRngCore` parameter. Gated on the `rand_core`.

Previously all of the `generate_*` methods were parameterized on a `CryptoRngCore`.

Splitting them up like this makes it very easy for users to do the right thing, which is use `getrandom`/`OsRng`, but without the need to document how to import `OsRng` into their code everywhere.

Retaining the parameterized versions as `*_with_rng` allows users to pass a custom RNG where it makes sense, for example `rand::thread_rng`, or potentially an embedded peripheral/entropy pool.

title: Migrate to `doc_auto_cfg`
body:
Migrates the `aead`, `cipher`, `crypto-common`, `digest`, and `universal-hash` crates to use the `doc_auto_cfg` feature which automatically generates documentation for `cfg`-gated code, which in our uses is almost exclusively gated on crate features.

This allows the previous manual `doc_cfg` annotations to be removed, which is nice as they otherwise duplicate work whenever `cfg`-gated code is used.

title: crypto-common: add SerializableState trait
body:
Trait for saving the internal state of the object and restoring it later.

Original PRs: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1078 https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1361

Original issue: https://github.com/RustCrypto/hashes/issues/310

title: cipher: remove needless lifetimes
body:
One of the lifetimes is unused, but we couldn't remove it before because it would be a breaking change.

Closes #1336

title: cipher: test `minimal-versions` on stable in CI
body:
I suspect a nightly regression is responsible for this build failure:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/actions/runs/6648272740/job/18065054230?pr=1319

title: cipher+digest: migrate to hybrid array; MSRV 1.65
body:
Continuation of #1319.    

Replaces `generic-array` with `hybrid-array`, which is built on a combination of `typenum` and const generics, providing a degree of interoperability between the two systems.

`hybrid-array` is designed to be a largely drop-in replacement, and the number of changes required to switch are relatively minimal aside from some idiosyncrasies.

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.6
body:
### Fixed
- Minimum supported `hkdf` version is v0.12.1 ([#1353])
- Minimum supported `serde_json` version for `jwk` feature is v1.0.47 ([#1354])
- Minimum supported `tap` version for `bits` feature is v1.0.1 ([#1355])

[#1353]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1353
[#1354]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1354
[#1355]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1355

title: elliptic-curve: minimum supported `tap` for `bits` is v1.0.1
body:
...when resolving with `-Z minimal-versions`

`tap` is a transitive dependency of `bitvec` by way of `wyz` v0.5, which misspecifies the required `tap` version. This is addressed in newer v0.6 releases of `wyz`, which `bitvec` does not yet use.

So, as a workaround, this adds an explicit `dep:tap` dependency on v1.0.1 for the `bits` feature.

This was the last remaining `minimal-versions` incompatibility in this crate, allowing all features to now be tested in the `minimal-versions` check in CI.

title: elliptic-curve: minimum supported `serde_json` is v1.0.47
body:
...when resolving with `-Z minimal-versions`

This appears to be due to earlier versions of `serde_json` itself misspecifying its required `serde` version.

title: elliptic-curve: fix `hkdf` version requirement and test in CI
body:
The minimal supported version of `hkdf` is v0.12.1, which added a generic parameter with a default which selects the backend.

This also (mostly) re-enables a `minimal-versions` check in CI, although it still doesn't quite test all features.

title: Fix minor documentation error in AeadCore::TagSize
body: The documentation originally described TagSize as "the maximum length of the nonce" when it is, in fact, the maximum length of the tag.

title: kem: fix MSRV tests in CI
body: `cc v1.0.82` has new MSRV equal to 1.61, see https://github.com/rust-lang/cc-rs/pull/849. It's a dev dependency, so tests will be run for 1.61, while true MSRV will be tested using build-only job.

title: build(deps): bump actions/checkout from 3 to 4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions
labels.description: Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code

body:
Bumps [actions/checkout](https://github.com/actions/checkout) from 3 to 4.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v4.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update default runtime to node20 by @​takost in actions/checkout#1436
  • Support fetching without the --progress option by @​simonbaird in actions/checkout#1067
  • Release 4.0.0 by @​takost in actions/checkout#1447

New Contributors

  • @​takost made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1436
  • @​simonbaird made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1067

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3...v4.0.0

v3.6.0

What's Changed

  • Mark test scripts with Bash'isms to be run via Bash by @​dscho in actions/checkout#1377
  • Add option to fetch tags even if fetch-depth > 0 by @​RobertWieczoreck in actions/checkout#579
  • Release 3.6.0 by @​luketomlinson in actions/checkout#1437

New Contributors

  • @​RobertWieczoreck made their first contribution in actions/checkout#579
  • @​luketomlinson made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1437

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3.5.3...v3.6.0

v3.5.3

What's Changed

  • Fix: Checkout Issue in self hosted runner due to faulty submodule check-ins by @​megamanics in actions/checkout#1196
  • Fix typos found by codespell by @​DimitriPapadopoulos in actions/checkout#1287
  • Add support for sparse checkouts by @​dscho and @​dfdez in actions/checkout#1369
  • Release v3.5.3 by @​TingluoHuang in actions/checkout#1376

New Contributors

  • @​megamanics made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1196
  • @​DimitriPapadopoulos made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1287
  • @​dfdez made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1369

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3...v3.5.3

v3.5.2

What's Changed

  • Fix: Use correct API url / endpoint in GHES by @​fhammerl in actions/checkout#1289 based on #1286 by @​1newsr

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/checkout/compare/v3.5.1...v3.5.2

v3.5.1

What's Changed

  • Improve checkout performance on Windows runners by upgrading @​actions/github dependency by @​BrettDong in actions/checkout#1246

New Contributors

  • @​BrettDong made their first contribution in actions/checkout#1246

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from actions/checkout's changelog.

Changelog

v4.0.0

  • Support fetching without the --progress option
  • Update to node20

v3.6.0

  • Fix: Mark test scripts with Bash'isms to be run via Bash
  • Add option to fetch tags even if fetch-depth > 0

v3.5.3

  • Fix: Checkout fail in self-hosted runners when faulty submodule are checked-in
  • Fix typos found by codespell
  • Add support for sparse checkouts

v3.5.2

  • Fix api endpoint for GHES

v3.5.1

  • Fix slow checkout on Windows

v3.5.0

  • Add new public key for known_hosts

v3.4.0

  • Upgrade codeql actions to v2
  • Upgrade dependencies
  • Upgrade @​actions/io

v3.3.0

  • Implement branch list using callbacks from exec function
  • Add in explicit reference to private checkout options
  • [Fix comment typos (that got added in #770)](actions/checkout#1057)

v3.2.0

  • Add GitHub Action to perform release
  • Fix status badge
  • Replace datadog/squid with ubuntu/squid Docker image
  • Wrap pipeline commands for submoduleForeach in quotes
  • Update @​actions/io to 1.1.2
  • Upgrading version to 3.2.0

v3.1.0

  • Use @​actions/core saveState and getState
  • Add github-server-url input

v3.0.2

  • Add input set-safe-directory

v3.0.1

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 3df4ab1 Release 4.0.0 (#1447)
  • 8b5e8b7 Support fetching without the --progress option (#1067)
  • 97a652b Update default runtime to node20 (#1436)

title: the derive.rs tests also depends on the digest feature
body:
Output without this patch:

```
$ cargo test --no-default-features --features derive
   Compiling signature v2.1.0 (/home/capitol/project/traits/signature)
error[E0433]: failed to resolve: use of undeclared crate or module `digest`
 --> signature/tests/derive.rs:5:5
  |
5 | use digest::{generic_array::GenericArray, Digest, OutputSizeUser};
  |     ^^^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `digest`

error[E0432]: unresolved imports `signature::DigestSigner`, `signature::DigestVerifier`, `signature::PrehashSignature`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:10:5
   |
10 |     DigestSigner, DigestVerifier, Error, PrehashSignature, SignatureEncoding, Signer, Verifier,
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ no `PrehashSignature` in the root
   |     |             |
   |     |             no `DigestVerifier` in the root
   |     no `DigestSigner` in the root

error[E0432]: unresolved import `digest`
 --> signature/tests/derive.rs:5:5
  |
5 | use digest::{generic_array::GenericArray, Digest, OutputSizeUser};
  |     ^^^^^^ help: a similar path exists: `sha2::digest`

error: cannot determine resolution for the derive macro `DigestSigner`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:49:18
   |
49 | #[derive(Signer, DigestSigner, Default)]
   |                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: import resolution is stuck, try simplifying macro imports

error: cannot determine resolution for the derive macro `DigestVerifier`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:62:20
   |
62 | #[derive(Verifier, DigestVerifier, Default)]
   |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: import resolution is stuck, try simplifying macro imports

error[E0405]: cannot find trait `PrehashSignature` in crate `signature`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:49:10
   |
49 | #[derive(Signer, DigestSigner, Default)]
   |          ^^^^^^ not found in `signature`
   |
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `Signer` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[E0405]: cannot find trait `DigestSigner` in crate `signature`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:49:10
   |
49 | #[derive(Signer, DigestSigner, Default)]
   |          ^^^^^^ not found in `signature`
   |
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `Signer` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[E0405]: cannot find trait `PrehashSignature` in crate `signature`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:62:10
   |
62 | #[derive(Verifier, DigestVerifier, Default)]
   |          ^^^^^^^^ not found in `signature`
   |
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `Verifier` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[E0405]: cannot find trait `DigestVerifier` in crate `signature`
  --> signature/tests/derive.rs:62:10
   |
62 | #[derive(Verifier, DigestVerifier, Default)]
   |          ^^^^^^^^ not found in `signature`
   |
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `Verifier` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

Some errors have detailed explanations: E0405, E0432, E0433.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0405`.
error: could not compile `signature` (test "derive") due to 9 previous errors
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```

With this patch:
```
$ cargo test --no-default-features --features derive,digest
    Updating crates.io index
  Downloaded quote v1.0.28
  Downloaded 1 crate (28.4 KB) in 0.64s
   Compiling version_check v0.9.4
   Compiling typenum v1.16.0
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.63
   Compiling unicode-ident v1.0.9
   Compiling quote v1.0.28
   Compiling cfg-if v1.0.0
   Compiling cpufeatures v0.2.8
   Compiling hex-literal v0.3.4
   Compiling generic-array v0.14.7
   Compiling syn v2.0.22
   Compiling block-buffer v0.10.4
   Compiling crypto-common v0.1.6
   Compiling digest v0.10.7
   Compiling sha2 v0.10.7
   Compiling signature_derive v2.0.1 (/home/capitol/project/traits/signature/derive)
   Compiling signature v2.1.0 (/home/capitol/project/traits/signature)
    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 7.42s
     Running unittests src/lib.rs (/home/capitol/project/traits/target/debug/deps/signature-9bb0c2156b7ac844)

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

     Running tests/derive.rs (/home/capitol/project/traits/target/debug/deps/derive-10be4c3b07749810)

running 2 tests
test derived_signer_impl ... ok
test derived_verifier_impl ... ok

test result: ok. 2 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

   Doc-tests signature

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

```

title: crypto v0.5.1
body: Unchanged from v0.5.0, but published to trigger a new docs.rs build

title: elliptic-curve: use `sec1::EcPrivateKey::PEM_LABEL`
body: Instead of defining a separate constant for this, it can be obtained from the `EcPrivateKey` type, which impls the `PemLabel` trait.

title: digest: explicitly state that size is measured in bytes
body: Closes #1308

title: crypto-common: migrate to `hybrid-array`; MSRV 1.65
body:
Replaces `generic-array` with `hybrid-array`, which is built on a combination of `typenum` and const generics, providing a degree of interoperability between the two systems.

`hybrid-array` is designed to be a largely drop-in replacement, and the number of changes required to switch are relatively minimal aside from some idiosyncracies.

title: crypto-common: use `CryptoRngCore`
body:
Added in `rand_core` v0.6.4.

I think in the next `rand_core` release we'll be able to replace it with `CryptoRng` (by leveraging a supertrait bound) but for now this reduces the number of traits needed to just one.

title: Fix Documentation for `struct Salt`
body: Fixes issue #1316.

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.5
body:
### Changed
- Faster `PublicKey::from_encoded_point` ([#1310])

### Fixed
- `alloc`+`arithmetic` features w/o `sec1` feature ([#1301])

[#1301]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1301
[#1310]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1310

title: universal-hash v0.5.1
body:
### Changed
- Loosen `subtle` version requirement to `^2.4` ([#1260])

[#1260]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1260

title: elliptic-curve: faster `PublicKey::from_encoded_point`
body: Checks if the SEC1 point is using the identity encoding directly, rather than round tripping through `ProjectivePoint`.

title: crypto v0.5.0
body:
### Changed
- Bump `signature` to v2 ([#1211])
- Bump `password-hash` to v0.5 ([#1271])
- Bump `elliptic-curve` to v0.13; MSRV 1.65 ([#1302])

[#1211]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1211
[#1271]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1271
[#1302]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1302

title: elliptic-curve: fix/test alloc+arithmetic features w/o sec1
body:
The combination of `alloc`+`arithmetic` would previously cause compile errors because some `sec1`-related code was not properly gated.

This fixes the feature gating.

title: signature_derive v2.0.1
body:
### Changed
- Bump `syn` to v2 ([#1299])

[#1299]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1299

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.4
body:
### Changed
- Bump `hex-literal` to v0.4 ([#1295])

### Fixed
- `NonZeroScalar::from_slice` ([#1296])
- `ScalarPrimitive::from_slice` ([#1296])

[#1295]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1295
[#1296]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1296

title: elliptic-curve: fix remaining `FieldBytesSize` handling
body:
Fixes the two remaining usages of `C::Uint::BYTES` to use `C::FieldBytesSize::USIZE` instead.

These usages were:

- `NonZeroScalar::from_slice`
- `ScalarPrimitive::from_slice`

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.3
body:
### Added
- Impl `AssociatedAlgorithmIdentifier` for `SecretKey` and `PublicKey` ([#1286])

### Changed
- Update OSSWU code ([#1157])
- Bump `pkcs8` to v0.10.2 ([#1291])

### Fixed
- `FieldBytesEncoding` provided impl ([#1287])

[#1157]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1157
[#1286]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1286
[#1287]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1287
[#1291]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1291

title: elliptic-curve: expand clippy lints
body:
Adds the following clippy lints and fixes violations thereof:

- clippy::cast_lossless
- clippy::cast_possible_truncation
- clippy::cast_possible_wrap
- clippy::cast_precision_loss
- clippy::cast_sign_loss
- clippy::checked_conversions
- clippy::implicit_saturating_sub
- clippy::integer_arithmetic
- clippy::panic
- clippy::panic_in_result_fn

title: elliptic-curve: fix FieldBytesEncoding ranges
body: This should fix methods like SecretKey::from_slice for curves where the number of bytes in their internal representation is larger than it's modulus (e.g. NIST P224)

title: elliptic-curve: impl `AssociatedAlgorithmIdentifier`
body: Adds impls for `SecretKey` and `PublicKey`

title: aead v0.5.2
body:
### Added
- `arrayvec` feature ([#1219])

[#1219]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1219

title: signature v2.1.0
body:
### Added
- `SignatureEncoding::encoded_len` ([#1283])

[#1283]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1283

title: signature: add `SignatureEncoding::encoded_len`
body: Adds a new provided method to the `SignatureEncoding` trait for computing the length of the signature when it's serialized.

title: Replace unmaintained actions-rs/* actions in CI workflows
body:
Basically all of the `actions-rs/*` actions are unmaintained. See <https://github.com/actions-rs/toolchain/issues/216> for more information. Due to their age they generate several warnings in CI runs, for example in https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/actions/runs/4369716863:

> Node.js 12 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 16: actions-rs/toolchain@v1, actions-rs/cargo@v1. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2022-09-22-github-actions-all-actions-will-begin-running-on-node16-instead-of-node12/.

To get rid of some of those warnings the occurrences of `actions-rs/toolchain` are replaced by [`dtolnay/rust-toolchain`](https://github.com/dtolnay/rust-toolchain), and the occurrences of `actions-rs/cargo` are replaced by direct invocations of `cargo`.

title: Fix unsoundness with block size equal to zero
body: Closes #1275

title: elliptic-curve: remove redundant bounds
body: Remove explicit bounds which are already ensured via supertrait bounds.

title: elliptic-curve v0.13.2
body:
### Added
- Weakly activate `pkcs8?/std` ([#1263])
- More `PublicKey` <-> SEC1 conversions ([#1272])

[#1263]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1263
[#1272]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1272

title: elliptic-curve: `PublicKey` <-> SEC1 conversions
body:
Adds the following conversion impls to `PublicKey`

- `TryFrom`: `sec1::{CompressedPoint`, `EncodedPoint}`
- `Into` (via `From`): `sec1::{CompressedPoint`, `EncodedPoint}`

title: password-hash v0.5.0
body:
### Added
- `Error::OutputSize` ([#1026])
- `std::error::Error::source` for `Error` ([#1264])
- `getrandom` feature ([#1267])

### Changed
- Use `Salt` type with `PasswordHasher` ([#1187])
- Rename `Salt::new` => `Salt::from_b64` ([#1266])
- Rename `Salt::b64_decode` => `Salt::decode_b64` ([#1266])
- Rename `SaltString::new` => `SaltString::from_b64` ([#1266])
- Rename `SaltString::b64_decode` => `SaltString::decode_b64` ([#1266])
- Rename `SaltString::b64_encode` => `SaltString::encode_b64` ([#1266])

### Fixed
- Allow `Salt` to be exactly the same amount as `MAX_LENGTH` value ([#1246])

[#1026]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1026
[#1187]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1187
[#1246]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1246
[#1264]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1264
[#1266]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1266
[#1267]: https://github.com/RustCrypto/traits/pull/1267

title: password-hash: use `doc_auto_cfg`
body: Automatically generate feature-specific documentation
